title: Is the Quran based on modern science? - Quora

response.answer_text: No it is not. Quran is based on an ancient Judaism and Pagan arabic religion. So called “science in Quran” is example of the same principle, which is used in astrology: “If statement has an infinite number of interpretations, nothing can disprove it” And the heaven We constructed with strength, and indeed, We are [its] expander. Qur’an 51:47 What does mean heaven? Cosmos? Ozon layer? Another dimension? Sky? What does mean expand? Moving? Expansion of space? Expansion of matter? There is no strict answear. Regardless on facts, it is always possible to create interpretation, which does not contradict modern science.

Since modern science did not exist when the Quran was revealed, it can not be said to be “based on” modern science. That does not mean that what the Quran says is not true, since very little (or none) of what the Quran says has to do with the topics and questions that modern science studies. Two books which are on totally differenttopics cannot be said to contradict each other: they are about different things. Similarly with the Quran. Before you judge an answer, make sure you know what the question was.
